Better Meeting Rooms is currently distributed via TestFlight, and new users must follow the onboarding process below.
To get the most out of the Better Meeting Rooms solution, your device must meet the following system requirements.

Better Meeting Rooms is a platform that helps organizations plan, design, and manage high-performing meeting rooms. Our app supports the full lifecycle of a meeting space ‚Äî from the first scan to long-term maintenance.
The Deployment Phase is where approved designs turn into real meeting rooms.
The Design Phase turns room data into a proposed setup ready for deployment.
The Discovery Phase is the first and most important step in the Better Meeting Rooms lifecycle.
The Maintenance Phase ensures that rooms remain effective and reliable after deployment.
This section contains practical recommendations to get reliable results during Discovery and beyond.
Below are portable speakers we have tested and verified for BMR‚Äôs Acoustic Measurements .

This is the third external beta release of the Better Meeting Rooms solution.

Better Meeting Rooms is currently distributed via TestFlight, and new users must follow the onboarding process below.

Your email must be submitted by the BMR team. Contact us at support@bettermeetingrooms.com You will receive an invitation from Apple TestFlight to install the app. Open the invitation on your iPhone or iPad and follow the link to install.

New accounts are created directly from the Better Meeting Rooms iOS app. When opening the app for the first time, you‚Äôll see the login and sign-up flow. Tap Login to begin. You will be redirected to the secure sign-up/login page. Tap Sign up at the bottom of the page. The Sign-up page is almost identical to the log in, but it is here you enter your e-mail and password. or choose to continue with Google or Cisco Webex single sign-on. Enter your company email address and create a strong password. Once completed, you can log in directly using your chosen method. ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: You must use your company email address (e.g., name@yourcompany.com) to ensure you are added to the correct organization. If you use a private email address (e.g., Gmail, Outlook, iCloud) you will not be able to access the same resources as your colleagues.
documents.s: üì± Step 2: Sign Up via the App (Primary)

documents.t: You can now access the app and start setting up rooms. üìå Make sure your company has already been set up in BMR. If not, contact your project lead or onboarding contact.

Q: How do I sign up? A: The primary way to sign up is through the iOS app (via TestFlight). You can use your company email with a password, or sign in with Google or Cisco Webex. Q: Can I use a personal email (like Gmail or Outlook)? A: Yes, but if you are part of a company you will not have access to the same information as your colleagues. You will need to use your company e-mail for that.

Q: Which devices support room scanning? A: Any iPhone 12 Pro or later (Pro/Pro Max), iPad Pro 11 2nd generation or later or iPad Pro 12.9 4th generation or later models with LiDAR. Q: Can I access BMR on the web? A: Yes. The web platform supports room management, design requests, acoustic comparisons, and global search.

Q: What is the Discovery Phase? A: Discovery is where you capture the room (scan + markers), run acoustic measurements, and upload schematics if needed. Q: What is the Design Phase? A: You can either create your own AR design with the iOS app or request a BMR-prepared design using the web questionnaire. Q: Can I approve designs? A: Not yet. Right now you can only request designs via the web. Approval will be available in an upcoming release. Q: What‚Äôs included in Deployment right now? A: Currently, Deployment provides approved designs and equipment lists. More structured installation guidance is coming. Q: What is Maintenance? A: Maintenance is where room data (scans, markers, equipment list, acoustics) supports troubleshooting, upgrades, and future integration with monitoring systems.

Q: Can I approve designs from the app? A: No ‚Äî design approval isn‚Äôt available yet on either platform. For now, you can request designs via the web only. Q: Can I schedule or assign tasks from the app? A: Not in this version. Task management and assignments will be added in upcoming releases. Q: Do you support Android devices? A: No. For now, the app runs only on iOS devices with LiDAR (iPhone 12 Pro or later, iPad Pro).
Q: Who do I contact if I get stuck? A: Contact your project lead or email support@bettermeetingrooms.com for assistance.
To get the most out of the Better Meeting Rooms solution, your device must meet the following system requirements.
info Recommended Device: ‚úÖ iPhone 13 Pro or newer ‚úÖ iPad Pro with LiDAR support

Device Type Supported Models iPhone iPhone 12 Pro iPhone 12 Pro Max iPhone 13 Pro iPhone 13 Pro Max iPhone 14 Pro iPhone 14 Pro Max iPhone 15 Pro iPhone 15 Pro Max iPad iPad Pro 11" (2nd gen, 2020) or newer iPad Pro 12.9" (4th gen, 2020) or newer Operating System: Requires iOS 16 or newer. We recommend always using the latest iOS version for best compatibility. caution Important: Only iPhones/iPads with LiDAR sensors can be used for scanning rooms.

You can access the BMR web dashboard using any modern browser. info Supported Browsers: Google Chrome (latest) Microsoft Edge (latest) Safari (latest) Firefox (latest) Recommended PC Specs for Best 3D Performance: ‚úÖ Intel i5 / AMD Ryzen 5 (or better) ‚úÖ 8 GB RAM or more ‚úÖ Dedicated GPU (optional but improves experience) ‚úÖ Screen resolution 1920x1080 or higher ‚úÖ Good internet connection (10 Mbps+)

Better Meeting Rooms is a platform that helps organizations plan, design, and manage high-performing meeting rooms. Our app supports the full lifecycle of a meeting space ‚Äî from the first scan to long-term maintenance.
We guide you through the four key phases of meeting room projects:

Capture and understand the current state of the room using scans, photos, and documentation. Measure acoustics, identify challenges, and gather all relevant data ‚Äî whether the room exists or is still in planning.

Use the collected data to generate optimized room layouts. Create AR-based mockups, get auto-generated suggestions, or request professional design options ‚Äî always based on real conditions and best practices.
Turn approved designs into action. Access complete installation details, equipment lists, and cabling diagrams. Reduce delays and confusion by ensuring every stakeholder has exactly what they need.
Keep rooms performing long after installation. Monitor key components, support troubleshooting, and request room updates based on usage or feedback ‚Äî all connected to the room‚Äôs original context.

Throughout the platform, we embed expert insights on: Acoustics ‚Äì Optimize for clarity, reduce noise, and boost speech intelligibility Lighting ‚Äì Ensure well-lit environments for both video and in-person meetings Technology ‚Äì Select the right AV gear and collaboration tools Furniture ‚Äì Choose ergonomic, functional setups Layout ‚Äì Design spaces that enable better interaction and communication You‚Äôll also find practical guides and templates for every phase of the room lifecycle.

Browse our documentation to learn how to use the app and improve your meeting spaces: Acoustics Guide ‚Äì Learn how to assess and improve audio performance More tutorials avilable in Tutorials and Video tutorials sections.

Well-designed meeting rooms lead to: Better hybrid collaboration Reduced deployment time and project cost More productive and engaging meetings Long-term room performance and satisfaction Let‚Äôs build better meeting rooms ‚Äî from first scan to final upgrade.
The Deployment Phase is where approved designs turn into real meeting rooms. At this stage, the goal is to ensure that every piece of equipment is installed correctly, following the agreed design.

Today, Deployment provides: Approved designs uploaded to the room Equipment list with all required devices and materials This ensures that partners and installers have the full bill of materials needed to order and set up the room.

Over the coming releases, Deployment will expand with: Installation guides generated per room Checklists for structured installation and quality assurance Integration with external service platforms (e.g., ServiceNow, Webex Control Hub) Progress tracking during installation Handover process into Maintenance

Confirmed installation package (design + equipment list) A starting point for the Maintenance Phase ‚ÑπÔ∏è The Deployment Phase is still evolving. Expect significant updates as we add automation, tracking, and integration with partner workflows.

The Design Phase turns room data into a proposed setup ready for deployment. Designs are based on: The scan (digital twin) Markers (photos & notes of key elements) Acoustic measurements (highly recommended) User requirements (use case, capacity, preferences) You can create a design in two ways:

Create a design yourself while you‚Äôre in the room. How it works Open the room in the iOS app and choose AR Design. Pick items from the Equipment Catalog (cameras, screens, mics, speakers, furniture, etc.). Place, rotate, and align 3D models in the scanned space. Save the configuration to the room. What you get Saved AR layout with placed items Auto‚Äëgenerated equipment list (based on placed models) Option to request a BMR review later Tip: Run (or upload) acoustic measurements first‚Äîplacement decisions get much easier.

Request a BMR‚Äëauthored design via the web. How it works Open the room on the web and click Request Design. Complete the questionnaire (capacity, seating style, content sharing, VC platform, screens, audio needs, constraints). Submit. BMR uses your scan, markers, acoustics, and answers to produce a design. What you get Design package uploaded to the room Equipment list with key components Acoustic recommendation (treatment type & quantity) Visuals such as camera view, audio coverage, and screen visibility (where available)
Open the room‚Äôs Library to view available designs. Inspect coverage visuals and the equipment list. Add comments or request adjustments. Approve when ready to move into Deployment.
One or more approved designs per room A consolidated equipment list for procurement Acoustic recommendation based on measurements and use case A review/approval trail tied to the room

‚úÖ Completed scan and markers ‚úÖ Acoustic measurement uploaded (recommended) ‚úÖ Clear requirements via the design questionnaire (if using Design Request) The better the Discovery data, the faster the Design‚Äîand the fewer changes later.

The Discovery Phase is the first and most important step in the Better Meeting Rooms lifecycle. During Discovery, you capture accurate data about your meeting room, which becomes the foundation for design and deployment.

Use your iPhone or iPad (with LiDAR) to create a digital twin of the room. Open the app and select Start Scan Move your device slowly around the room until all walls and surfaces are captured Save the scan ‚Äì it will appear in the Scan Library üì∏ Example screenshot here

Markers is the way to capture important details like power outlets, network outlets, displays, cameras etc.... While scanning, tap Camera buttonr An image is taken of the area, and saved as a marker üì∏ Example screenshot here

Capture the acoustic profile of your room. Speaker Test: Play a test sound and capture detail reverberation and sound propagation data. Balloon Pop: Use a balloon to capture RT60 (reverberation time) (BETA) All acoustic measurements are stored in the Acoustics Library. üì∏ Example screenshot here

After completing Discovery, you will have: A digital twin of the room Marker data (outlets, devices, furniture, etc) Acoustic measurements Optional uploaded schematics/drawings This data flows into the Design Phase for creating layouts, equipment lists, and collaboration experiences.

The Maintenance Phase ensures that rooms remain effective and reliable after deployment. It builds on the Discovery and Design data captured earlier, providing a foundation for troubleshooting, upgrades, and lifecycle management.

At this stage, Maintenance is primarily supported by the information collected during Discovery and Design, including: Digital twin of the room (scan + markers) Equipment list associated with the latest design Acoustic measurements and recommendations Room history (activities, updates, approvals) This ensures that support teams and facility managers have a single source of truth about the room.

Future Maintenance features will expand to include: Live integration with external platforms Automated status monitoring of installed devices Troubleshooting workflows directly linked to the room‚Äôs data Upgrade requests to initiate new Discovery/Design cycles Lifecycle analytics to track performance and usage over time
Centralised room record with all data accessible Faster troubleshooting and reduced downtime A clear path for room upgrades and continuous improvement

This section contains practical recommendations to get reliable results during Discovery and beyond. Speakers for acoustics ‚Äî how to choose and set up a speaker for the Speaker Test, plus room setup tips. (More coming soon) Camera placement, marker photography, and scanning best practices. The quality of inputs (scan, markers, and acoustics) directly impacts the time and accuracy of the Design phase.
Below are portable speakers we have tested and verified for BMR‚Äôs Acoustic Measurements . They provide adequate bandwidth and output for rooms up to ~70 m¬≤ when positioned correctly.

Name Manufacturer Max room size More information JBL Xtreme 4 JBL 70 m¬≤ Product description Beosound Explore Bang & Olufsen 70 m¬≤ Product description Replace the # links with your preferred product pages.

Powered speaker (no external amp), clean output 80 Hz‚Äì15 kHz+ Can play ~10‚Äì15 dB above background without obvious distortion Stable placement on a stand at ~1.3 m (seated head height) This page only lists speaker choices. A separate guide will cover how to run the acoustic measurement.

The latest update to the Better Meeting Rooms solution brings powerful enhancements to search, libraries, and room management.

Acoustic comparison between measurements, including across different rooms Added disclaimer and adjusted messaging for balloon acoustic measurements Improved stability and performance for scans and measurements

Global search for all scans, designs, and measurements you have access to New Acoustic Library with room name, date, creator, and search/filter functions Implemented Library Page to view files with associated room names

iPhone/iPad app refinements for room status tracking and activity logs Show project phase (Discovery, Design, Deployment) in room details Create new rooms directly from Location View Updated room list view on the web for faster navigation
Advanced search on the web for rooms, organizations, and locations Expanded organization view with linked users, rooms, and default room configurations
Streamlined invitation and team member setup process Stay tuned for future updates and improvements. We continue to improve and add new value.
This is the third external beta release of the Better Meeting Rooms solution.

Acoustic measurement improvements ‚Äì refined accuracy and results In-app feedback available from the admin menu Room measurements (floor area, volume, dimensions) shown after scanning Offline mode support My Tasks ‚Äì initial version, shows actions done while the phone was offline Add markers without scanning Create Location directly from the Organisation view Landscape scanning enabled

My Tasks ‚Äì view tasks performed, take ownership of tasks Process view update ‚Äì assign in-room tasks directly from the room Improved acoustics view with comparison and reference values Room overview now includes floor area, volume, and dimensions Enhanced scan visualization with 2D view and notes Stay tuned for further improvements as we continue to refine the solution together with our beta users.
This is the fourth external beta release of the Better Meeting Rooms solution.

Add Markers separately From the room and from + Create. Markers can now be added independently of a full room scan to allow quicker updates, corrections, or late additions. Acoustic measurement improvements Better stability and guidance during measurements. We‚Äôve refined measurement timing and made results more consistent across devices. Room measurement improvements (accuracy) Room dimensions now yield more accurate results, improving alignment between the scan data and design visualization. Capture new room Hero image with live camera Set or update a room‚Äôs hero image directly from the live camera preview to ensure the latest visuals are available during the design phase.

Breadcrumbs menu with hierarchy always available Navigate Organization ‚Üí Location ‚Üí Room ‚Üí Section from anywhere. This persistent navigation helps users maintain context between phases. New Design review page Review design submissions with clearer actions and statuses. Includes improved comment threads and version awareness. Side-by-side design comparison view Compare two design options at once to speed up approval. Includes synchronized scrolling and change highlighting for quick decisions. Room task assignment for Discovery and Design Assign and reassign tasks to the right person faster directly from the room overview. Admins can now delegate both Discovery and Design tasks from the same view. New Profile page Edit personal info and see organization assignments at a glance. Includes clearer structure for permissions and role visibility. Persistent search The search phrase now remains active until you clear it, making it easier to refine and revisit filtered results. Perfect for users who navigate multiple rooms or teams.
Welcome to better acoustics for better meetings with BMR Acoustics.

You'll need: An iPhone or iPad A speaker (Bluetooth or AirPlay) or a balloon A quiet room Instructions: Close all windows and doors Turn off all noise sources (HVAC, electronics, etc.) Protect your ears If using a speaker, start at medium volume If using a balloon, hold it ~30 cm away before popping Pro Tips: Place the speaker or balloon away from the iPhone/iPad Ensure your device's microphone is uncovered Place the device on a stable, non-rattling surface Multiple measurements = more reliable data

Launch the BMR app Measurment can be starte : A. Tap on + Create on tab bar B. Go to Acoustics tab of a room and tap on New Measurement Choose your test method: Sweep: Plays a test sound via connected speaker Impulse: Records a balloon pop or hand clap ‚ö†Ô∏è Hand claps are inconsistent ‚Äî use only as a last resort. ‚ö†Ô∏è *Baloon pop is BETA - for more reliable measurement use external speaker and sweep

Use one or our **Recommended speakers" or a speaker that follow the Recommendations specification ‚ö†Ô∏è Speakers that are not powerful enough will result in unreiliable measurments If the speaker appears in the app: Tap the exclamation mark (!) to open a popup Select your speaker from the list
Internal mic + connected speaker should be shown Begin with medium volume Protect your ears Tap Start Measurement Do not move or make noise during the measurement!
Wait for the "Measurement Complete" screen Tap See Results
Tap Save Results If started from a room measurements are saved to that room. If started from + Create you get the option to save where you want.
A countdown begins You will see the ambient noise level Avoid all background noise If the noise floor is too high, the app will show a measurement error
When prompted: Pop the balloon Remain silent for about 3 seconds
The app will show the results once the impulse is detected Save results using the same method as above
Your data helps calculate reverberation times and required room absorption to optimize speech intelligibility. More info: www.bettermeetingrooms.com/getready
This guide shows how to perform a room scan and place markers using the Better Meeting Rooms iPhone/iPad app.
üöÄ Starting a Scan üîç Scanning in Progress üì∏ Taking Markers ‚úÖ Finalizing the Scan
You can initiate a scan in two ways: From the Create menu: From a Room page:

Once started, follow on-screen instructions to move your phone along the walls of the room. Scan screen as you move along. White lineas appear as room geometry is captured: Move around until: White lines have covered all walls and corners The 3D preview closely matches the real room

During scanning: Tap the camera icon (center bottom) to take a marker photo The icon in the bottom-left corner updates with a marker count Tap that icon to preview markers taken Long press a marker in the preview to delete it Markers being taken: Marker preview gallery:

When you believe the scan is complete, tap Finish scanning. You‚Äôll see a preview of the scanned digital twin: Scan review screen: You can now choose: Proceed ‚Äì save the scan Retake ‚Äì discard and restart If the scan was initiated from a room page, it‚Äôs automatically saved to that room. If started from + Create, you‚Äôll be prompted to assign it to an existing or new: Organisation Location Room ‚ÑπÔ∏è Stay tuned for more tutorials.
